verses.verse: Hear <S%H8085><s%> this, <S%H5971><s%> all you peoples. Listen, <S%H8085><s%> all you inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of the world, <S%H2465><s%>
both low <S%H1121><s%> and high, <S%H1121><s%> rich <S%H6223><s%> and poor <S%H34><s%> together. <S%H3162><s%>
My mouth <S%H6310><s%> will speak <S%H1696><s%> words of wisdom. <S%H2454><s%> My heart <S%H3820><s%> shall utter <S%H1900><s%> understanding. <S%H8394><s%>
I will incline <S%H5186><s%> my ear <S%H241><s%> to a proverb. <S%H4912><s%> I will open <S%H6605><s%> my riddle <S%H2420><s%> on the harp. <S%H3658><s%>
Why should I fear <S%H3372><s%> in the days <S%H3117><s%> of evil, <S%H7451><s%> when iniquity <S%H5771><s%> at my heels <S%H6120><s%> surrounds me? <S%H5437><s%>
Those who trust <S%H982><s%> in their wealth, <S%H2428><s%> and boast <S%H1984><s%> in the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of their riches <S%H6239><s%>—
none of them can <S%H376><s%> by any means <S%H6299><s%> redeem <S%H6299><s%> his brother, <S%H251><s%> nor give <S%H5414><s%> God <S%H430><s%> a ransom for him. <S%H3724><s%>
For the redemption <S%H6306><s%> of their life <S%H5315><s%> is costly, <S%H3365><s%> no payment is ever <S%H5769><s%> enough, <S%H2308><s%>
That he should live <S%H2421><s%> on forever, <S%H5331><s%> that he should not see <S%H7200><s%> corruption. <S%H7845><s%>

For he sees <S%H7200><s%> that wise men <S%H2450><s%> die; <S%H4191><s%> likewise <S%H3162><s%> the fool <S%H3684><s%> and the senseless <S%H1198><s%> perish, <S%H6><s%> and leave <S%H5800><s%> their wealth <S%H2428><s%> to others. <S%H312><s%>

Their inward <S%H7130><s%> thought is that their houses <S%H1004><s%> will endure forever, <S%H5769><s%> and their dwelling <S%H4908><s%> places to all <S%H1755><s%> generations. <S%H1755><s%> They name <S%H7121><s%> their lands <S%H127><s%> after themselves. <S%H8034><s%>
But man, <S%H120><s%> despite his riches, <S%H3366><s%> doesn't <S%H3885><s%> endure. He is like <S%H4911><s%> the animals <S%H929><s%> that perish. <S%H1820><s%>
This is the destiny <S%H1870><s%> of those who are foolish, <S%H3689><s%> and of those <S%H310><s%> who approve <S%H7521><s%> their sayings. <S%H6310><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>

They are appointed <S%H8371><s%> as a flock <S%H6629><s%> for Sheol. <S%H7585><s%> Death <S%H4194><s%> shall be their shepherd. <S%H7462><s%> The upright <S%H3477><s%> shall have dominion <S%H7287><s%> over them in the morning. <S%H1242><s%> Their beauty <S%H6697><s%> shall decay <S%H1086><s%> in Sheol, <S%H7585><s%> far from their mansion. <S%H2073><s%>
But God <S%H430><s%> will redeem <S%H6299><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> from the power <S%H3027><s%> of Sheol, <S%H7585><s%> for he will receive <S%H3947><s%> me. <S%H5542><s%> Selah.
Don't <S%H3372><s%> be afraid when a man <S%H376><s%> is made rich, <S%H6238><s%> when the glory <S%H3519><s%> of his house <S%H1004><s%> is increased. <S%H7235><s%>
For when he dies <S%H4194><s%> he shall carry nothing away. <S%H3947><s%> His glory <S%H3519><s%> shall not descend <S%H3381><s%> after him. <S%H310><s%>
Though while he lived <S%H2416><s%> he blessed <S%H1288><s%> his soul <S%H5315><s%>— and men praise <S%H3034><s%> you when you do well for yourself <S%H3190><s%>—
he shall go <S%H935><s%> to the generation <S%H1755><s%> of his fathers. <S%H1><s%> They shall never <S%H3808><s%> see <S%H7200><s%> the light. <S%H216><s%>
A man <S%H120><s%> who has riches <S%H3366><s%> without understanding, <S%H995><s%> is like <S%H4911><s%> the animals <S%H929><s%> that perish. <S%H1820><s%>
